availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund Faulconer, Jr. (Harrison County, KY, farmhand )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmhand. Kentucky native. Son of Edmund Faulconer and Elizabeth Hedger Faulconer. Married to Maria Robinson Faulconer on August 14, 1865. Resident of Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 135A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 529.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 116A.
James G. Faulconer, Thomas Faulconer and His Descendants, (Baltimore, MD: Gateway Press, Inc, 1984), 22.
